Foxx's breakthrough in the entertainment industry came when he created and starred in the sketch comedy series "The Jamie Foxx Show" (1996-2001). The show's success led to numerous other acting opportunities, including film roles in "Ali" (2001), "Collateral" (2004), and "Ray" (2004), for which he won the Academy Award for Best Actor.

In addition to his acting career, Foxx has continued to make music. He released his second studio album, "Intuition," in 2008, which featured the hit single "Blame It." He has also collaborated with other artists, including Kanye West and T-Pain.

Foxx has been recognized for his philanthropic work, particularly in the area of education. He has donated to several charities, including the United Service Organizations and the Boys and Girls Clubs of America.

Throughout his career, Foxx has received numerous awards and nominations, including two Academy Award nominations, four Golden Globe nominations, and multiple Grammy nominations. He has also been named one of Time magazine's 100 most influential people in the world.

Today, Foxx continues to act, produce, and make music. He has been a part of various projects, including the "Django Unchained" soundtrack, the Netflix series "Project Power," and the "White House Correspondents' Dinner." With his versatility, talent, and dedication to his craft, Jamie Foxx remains one of the most respected and beloved figures in the entertainment industry.
